meta.title: CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) RESPONSE - District - Huron Valley Schools

div.p: Huron Valley Schools continues to monitor the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation in Michigan, the U.S. and throughout the world.

On April 2, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer signed an Executive Order suspending in-person education of K-12 students through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Read the full text of the Executive Order below.

Huron Valley Schools submitted the Continuity of Learning Plan to Oakland Schools on Thursday, April 16, 2020 as required by the Governor's executive order. The plan was approved on Friday, April 17, 2020 and can be accessed at the link below.

img.a: HVS Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan

div.p: HVS Superintendent Dr. Paul Salah hosted his first virtual coffee hour on Wednesday, April 22. Dr. Salah and the Central Office Administrative Team discussed the district’s learn at home plan, legislative issues related to schools, bond projects and general school district operations. A recording of this live-streamed event is available below.

img.a: Dr. Paul Salah interview with Mike Campbell, WWJ Radio

div.p: The following list of resources is designed to help during your time at home. Here, you can see communications from Superintendent Dr. Paul Salah, check meal distribution times and locations and utilize many available learning resources and more.

Many students depend on our schools to provide breakfast and lunch. Working with the USDA and Michigan Department of Education, HVS has identified multiple sites for families to access free “grab and go” food supplies throughout this extended period of closure.
Grab & Go Food Distribution Schedule
Grab & Go Food Distribution Schedule (effective April 27)
All Huron Valley students are receiving information from teachers on a weekly basis. To contact your child's teacher, visit the Staff Directory to send them an email.
General learning resources are available here for all grade levels.
